title: 2003 European heat wave
summary: The 2003 European heat wave led to what was, at the time, the hottest summer on record in Europe since at least 1540.[2][3] France was hit especially hard. The heat wave led to health crises in several countries and combined with drought to create a crop shortfall in parts of Southern Europe. Peer-reviewed analysis places the European death toll at more than 70,000.[4]
